com.novell.ldapchai.util
Class ChaiUtility

java.lang.Object
  com.novell.ldapchai.util.ChaiUtility

public class ChaiUtility
extends Object

A collection of static helper methods used by the LDAP Chai API.

Generally, consumers of the LDAP Chai API should avoid calling these methods directly. Where possible, use the ChaiEntry wrappers instead.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

Method Detail

createGroup

public static ChaiGroup createGroup(String parentDN,
                                    String name,
                                    ChaiProvider provider)
                             throws ChaiOperationException,
                                    ChaiUnavailableException
Creates a new group entry in the ldap directory. A new "groupOfNames" object is created. The "cn" and "description" ldap attributes are set to the supplied name.

Parameters:
parentDN - the entryDN of the new group.
name - name of the group
provider - a ldap provider be used to create the group.
Returns:
an instance of the ChaiGroup entry
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

findUniqueName

public static String findUniqueName(String baseName,
                                    String containerDN,
                                    ChaiProvider provider)
                             throws ChaiOperationException,
                                    ChaiUnavailableException
Derives a unique entry name for an ldap container. Assumes CN as the naming attribute.

Parameters:
baseName - A text name that will be used for the base of the obejct name. Punctuation and spaces will be stripped.
containerDN - Directory container in which to check for a unique name
provider - ChaiProvider to use for ldap connection
Returns:
Fully qualified unique object name for the container specified.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

createUser

public static ChaiUser createUser(String userDN,
                                  String sn,
                                  ChaiProvider provider)
                           throws ChaiOperationException,
                                  ChaiUnavailableException
Creates a new user entry in the ldap directory. A new "inetOrgPerson" object is created in the ldap directory. Generally, calls to this method will typically be followed by a call to the returned ChaiUser's write methods to add additional data to the ldap user entry.

Parameters:
userDN - the new userDN.
sn - the last name of
provider - a ldap provider be used to create the group.
Returns:
an instance of the ChaiUser entry
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

                          throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                 ChaiOperationException
Convert to an LDIF format. Useful for debugging or other purposes

Parameters:
theEntry - A valid ChaiEntry
Returns:
A string containing a properly formated LDIF view of the entry.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

testAttributeReplication

public static boolean testAttributeReplication(ChaiEntry chaiEntry,
                                               String attribute,
                                               String value)
                                        throws ChaiOperationException,
                                               ChaiUnavailableException
Test the replication of an attribute. It is left to the implementation to determine the means and criteria for this operation. Typically this method would be used just after a write operation in some type of time delayed loop.

Typical implementations will do the following:

  • issue ChaiEntry.readStringAttribute(String) to read a value
  • establish an LDAP connection to all known replicas
  • issue ChaiEntry.compareStringAttribute(String, String) to to each server directly
  • return true if each server contacted has the same value, false if not

Target servers that are unreachable or return errors are ignored, and do not influence the results. It is entirely possible that no matter how many times this method is called, false will always be returned, so the caller should take care not to repeat a test indefinitly.

This operation is potentially expensive, as it may establish new LDAP level connections to each target server each time it is invoked.

The following sample shows how this method might be used. There are a few important attributes of the sample:

  • Multiple ldap servers are specified
  • There is a pause time between each replication check (the test can be expensive)
  • There is a timeout period (the test may never successfully complete)
   ChaiUser theUser =                                                                     // create a new chai user.
      ChaiFactory.quickProvider("ldap://ldaphost,ldap://ldaphost2","cn=admin,ou=ou,o=o","novell");
 

   theUser.writeStringAttributes("description","testValue" + (new Random()).nextInt());    // write a random value to an attribute
 

   final int maximumWaitTime = 120 * 1000;                                                // maximum time to wait for replication
   final int pauseTime = 3 * 1000;                                                        // time between iterations
 

   final long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();                                     // timestamp of beginning of wait
   boolean replicated = false;
   while (System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime < maximumWaitTime) {                     // loop until
       try { Thread.sleep(pauseTime); } catch (InterruptedException e)  {}                // sleep between iterations
       replicated = ChaiUtility.testAttributeReplication(theUser,"description",null);     // check if data replicated yet
       if (replicated) {
           break;                                                                         // break if data has replicated
       }
   }
   System.out.println("Attribute replication successful: " + replicated);                 // report success

Parameters:
chaiEntry - A valid entry
attribute - A valid attribute on the entry
value - The value to test for. If null, a value is read from the active server
Returns:
true if the attribute is the same on all servers
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state

public static String passwordPolicyToString(ChaiPasswordPolicy policy)

determineDirectoryVendor

public static ChaiProvider.DIRECTORY_VENDOR determineDirectoryVendor(ChaiEntry rootDSE)
                                                              throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                                                     ChaiOperationException
Determines the vendor of a the ldap directory by reading RootDSE attributes

Parameters:
rootDSE - A valid entry
Returns:
the proper directory vendor, or ChaiProvider.DIRECTORY_VENDOR.GENERIC if the vendor can not be determined.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory is unreachable
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error reading values from the Root DSE entry
